title: Explore get_turn_recap MCP tool for multiplayer event summaries
description:
In 4-player Commander, 3 opponents take full turns between yours. The LLM currently must call get_game_state (verbose, ~500 tokens) or get_game_log (unstructured wall of text) to figure out what changed. A get_turn_recap tool could return a compressed event list since the player's last turn.

Key design question: can this maintain the 'MCP server reports game state, doesn't give strategic advice' invariant?

A raw event list is factual ('Alice cast Wrath of God, 7 creatures destroyed'), but any summarization or prioritization ('the key event was...') crosses into strategic advice. The tool must be a factual event log, not an analysis.

Design work needed:
1. Define exactly which events get included (spells cast, combat damage, life changes, permanents entering/leaving, card draws?)
2. Define the output format - structured JSON events vs human-readable strings
3. Decide whether this belongs in Java (MCP layer, has access to game events) or Python (harness, would need to parse game log)
4. Consider: is this just a filtered/formatted view of get_game_log? Could we add a 'since_turn' parameter to get_game_log instead of a whole new tool?
5. Token budget: estimate output size per turn cycle to ensure this actually saves tokens vs get_game_state
